content: The possibilities with this app are every landscape photographer's dream. Some great work by the devs!

content: Planit Pro is undoubtedly the best app I have ever bought or I am ever likely to buy. It may appear expensive for an app. But it is not for what you get. How the developer includes just about every feature you could want, or think of, into such a small footprint, I just don't know. The support is excellent and the developer is very to input and suggestions.
Excellent tool to plan a photo shoot

Not working anymore, I paid for this app and now can't use it because can't update from my location... Edit: I managed to update the app and now it's working (the problem was caused by PlayStore not working in China)
replyContent: Please email info@planitphoto.com with details so that we can understand what‚Äôs going on and help you resolve the issue.

content: Always helpful
Excellent!! Powerful tool!

Great app! Very easy to use once you get the idea! Excellent interface - very smooth and comfortable. I love the VR feature. It is great to be able to see how the scene would look like without having to be at the actual spot. I only miss some DoF, FoV tables and some calculators directly accessible without creating a scene. It would be nice to be able to set more than one camera in the settings so that you can easily chose afterwards when making the plan. 5* from me! Excellent work!
replyContent: Thank you for the review. For the camera location, what I normally do is to add a camera marker for those possible camera locations. With those markers on the map, I can easily drag my camera pin to snap into those locations.

content: I've been using PlanItPro for about a year now, mainly in planning out sunset/sunrise, Milky Way (unsuccessful due to light pollution) snaps, and trying to set up shots of the sun in unusual settings and backgrounds. I never used it for anything else mainly because I didn't know it had any other functions! Flash-forward to today and our over 10 days of chasing Comet Neowise. We get out earlier to see the sunset, then wait about an hour impatiently for the stars to begin shining in the darkening evening sky. We are using up to three different apps at home on a laptop, dumbphones and computers set to the time when we would finally see the Big Dipper (key to finding the comet), once we are on-location at our light-polluted spot we've chose for the grand occasion. Considering we have already previsualized the comet's location on screens at home, it would still take us an average of an hour if not longer to just FIND the comet! All of these apps seem to place Jupiter and Saturn well, along with the Moon, but turn to the NW for our Big Dipper, those apps all lost its accuracy. Even tho calibrated several times on the spot for best results, the dumbphone app and apps used at home would place Big Dipper and comet abt 20 to 35¬∞ off and to the east! So two days ago we finally gave up on chasing the comet since we would spend so much time trying to find it as it sinks lower and lower in the sky that we would be getting home well after midnight. Then the wife reads an online writeup about someone using PlanItPro to recently shoot the comet and stated "it was quite accurate" in locating the comet!! Remember, we have been using THREE other similar apps that were way off for not only the comet's position, but all our other references we needed to locate the comet. So we decided on a test since I have the PlanItPro app. So after reading the users guides of the virtual viewfinder and star shooting, I understood those functions well enough for an actual test. After checking the app and trying it indoors, we took a short walk and used the V(AR) at the spot where I wanted to capture the comet, then returned home for the wait. Remember, we'd usually would be on location very early to wait for the Big Dipper (about an hour after sunset) to begin our frantic search for the comet. This time though, with PlanItPro already loaded on the screen and now knowing more or less where it would/should be, I insisted on waiting till the Big Dipper was visible, before we were there. Sure enough, later in the darkness, I found the comet within minutes instead of hours! In fact, according to PlanItPro, there were three other comets near Neowise!!! You can bet I will be using this FABULOUS tool called PlanItPro a lot more now, and will be very confident in its tested accuracy! Thanks for such a great app that works wonders IF you read the guides, and is so much more accurate than other apps, and now your app replaces four other apps I used for the "same" use!!!

Two stars for the moment - but I'm sure i'll be increasing the rating in time. Currently, however, there are a few bugs that make the app unusable - and they revolve around storage access and permissions. I currently have given the app access to everything it has requested, however, the app still does not have the ability to access the phone's storage, or read photos I've taken with the phone for the 'Viewfinder Picture feature that I would like to use for planning a scene of a target of unknown height. Additionally, I cannot download the elevation files locally because the app still is not maintaining the permissions to access storage on my phone (downloads stay in paused state - pressing 'play' button switches to 'pause' immediately). I've checked the app permission settings for all apps, and PlanIt Pro is listed as having permission to "Access photos, media, and files on your device." If these permissions issues aren't fixed, the app is mostly useless to me
replyContent: A new update 9.10.3 is the on the way already which will fix the issue. Android 10 and 11 are no longer allowing us to write to root folder so we will have to do a file migration in the next next release. Otherwise we will not be able to release it on the play store. So stay tune for that.

content: I only gave it 5 stars because I couldn't give it more. Best planning app for photographers available.

Use this all the time to plan my shots. Powerful interface that is simple to use. Sat down in January this year and worked out the shots I could get in Crete in July from 4000km away down to the minute, just landed there a couple of hours ago.
Best app ever i used

I absolutely love this app! I have been able to plan so many awesome shots with this app. I would be lost without it. This is a night photographers "must have." Kudos to the designer and developer for this one! Phenomenal app!

Its a must have application if you are in to night astro landscape photography. I have been using this since last two years. Very accurate and user friendly. I would rate it more then 5 if I could. Cheers to the developers. üëç

The more I use it the more I find it does. You really need to watch the videos or read the manuals though. This isn't a piece of software you will understand by just pushing buttons to see what happens. If you do, you are going to miss out on so much.
replyContent: Thanks Mark! What you said is so true.

content: This app is invaluable for any photographer that shoots outdoors.
Amazing app. A must have for all photographers! Download it today!!
I would love to see weather conditions for this app. As well as astronomical and stargazing weather conditions.
replyContent: We actually did a beta with some weather features but couldn't persuade ourselves to do it. The complexity of weather feature would make planit too complicated to use, which is already complicated as it is now. I would recommend you to give Windy (red icon one) a try. I used it myself all the time for all my weather need.

content: Great app, but navigating through the various features can be challenging at times. Still very useful for all sorts of photography.
Makes location scouting and planning a shoot so much easier, great app üëå
Is the best investment for photography.

content: Used this for about a year now, and I think I've barely scratched the surface of all the features the app has to offer. Always my go to app when planning any shoot, whether astro or landscape.
Best photograpgy app

Almost perfect, just too bad that we don't get a pc software (when I need to use it on my pc, I have to use the android emulator Genymotion). The enormous advantage of the app is that we can ask it when the sun or the moor will be at a specific position in the sky.

Very good, in fact more than enough! All the info you will ever need in landscape photography. The interface can be a bit too clutter, too much info on our small mobile phone. The really unique feature is their VR viewfinder, but seems like no buildings in the VR viewfinder, only natural landscape. So street view may benefit in this aspect, however it will be coming soon as subscription according to info in the app. I am also using sun surveyor app, they still have the street view available.
replyContent: I am not sure how they did it but Google indeed charges a fee for streetview usages which is quite high. For now, you can share the location to Google Map and launch streetview inside Google Map, but it is not as convenence. For buildings, you can add markers that have width and height to simulate buildings.

Why are the 3D models of buildings not included in the VR view? Responding to markers in view instead of buildings : how do I turn those on? They are not visible in my view.
replyContent: Please email info@planitphoto.com if you prefer a more effective communication. The review system is horrible as they limit my reply work count. It was not designed for user to give detailed feedbacks.

content: Wonderful tool. Quick and helpful responses from the developer!

The problem is the paid user could over use the quota (unless we price it very high whcih we really don't want to do). 2. Charge a usage fee as Google does. This way can be easily hacked. Neither way works. Any thoughts?

content: I have been using this app from when it was first released, then I bought the pro version, the pro version is what you need for full functionality, yes it can be quite intimidating at first, but if you work at it, it is not too hard to learn.
Not very user friendly, lack of instructional videos.
Forced update notification is very annoying. Even if I click on *update later* it forces the app to exit. When I open the app again I get the same msg. Can you let me update later please?
replyContent: Sorry about it, Daisuke. We had to do that in order to prevent pirating. The particular version you had before was pirated so we had to force upgrading. In most cases, we will give you 5 times grace period before forcing you to upgrade. Hope you can understand. We also keep upgrading the features so being on the latest version is always good.

content: This is the most comprehensive and most versatile photography planning mobile app I have found. The UI can be quite intimidating at first, but once figured out (with the help of the very informative and well-made video tutorials and user manuals prepared by the developer himself), you will come to appreciate why it was designed that way. Features such as ‚ÄúSun/Moon Finder‚Äù and ‚ÄúMilky Way Seeker‚Äù simply have no rival among all photography planning apps. The VR view finder is amazing and works differently than the AR view found in other apps such as Sun Surveyor and PhotoPills. VR view allows you to visualize the composition with the focal length of your choice with great precision without having to be present at the planned location. The developer tried to fit many things on the screen and sometimes it can be challenging to access certain items on the screen with your finger, but since my device is a Galaxy Note 8, the S-Pen works very well with the app. The app is actively developed and you can expect very regular updates.
Outstanding tool to help visualize and plan photographic setups and shots. Works great! This should be in every photographers toolkit.
VR is awesome

Use it all the time, best app I've found and well worth the money if you want a powerful tool for planning your photos. Interface takes a few minutes to figure out but well worth the effort. Also love that it's still getting updates 5 years later.
replyContent: Thank you Nathan!

content: Very helpful app, certainly not going to complain about buying the pro version. Worth the couple of pounds it cost.

content: I have been using the Pro on my HTC One M7 for sometime and later on started using it on Google Pixel. Love the way it works. I am yet to explore all the features of this app.  I have 2 questions:  1. Recently I was trying the Street view for a milky way planning and it seemed to be not smooth at all. I am using it on my Google Pixel.  Is this normal? 2. Is there a way to save the maps for offline use?(If yes how?) Most of the places I go to click the pictures do not have cell coverage and when I use this app in those places I do not get to see the map at all and the app becomes useless.   Suggestions: It would be great if you could have a way to tell what is the meaning of each label on a screen. For e.g. In the Stars interface I don't know what is the Magnitude column in the table. Also it would be great if these columns could be sortable by clicking the column name.
replyContent: Streetview is slow because to convert direction to screen coordinate is slow. I couldn't find a solution unless Google fixes it. Google map doesn't support offline. They had it in their own app but didn't provide it to other apps who use Google map. However, without the map, you can still use the app. Email me. Reply comment is limited in length.

content: For people in the UK the possibility of using ordnance survey maps 1:25000 would make finding objects easier on location. I'm struggling to pinpoint the Old man of Stor on the isle of Skye and get it to appear in the viewfinder mode. Is not easy using the terrain map as it's a rock tower.  It maybe possible using an import file but that's not easy on location. I can only guess at the work that has gone into this app, your attention to detail and the programming needed to calculate everything this app can do is no small undertaking. Simply amazing.
replyContent: Importing kmls would be a good way to do it. Using the Google Earth on computer, add marker in it then save as a kml file to Google Drive. Open the kml from your phone Google Dive app will prompt to use the planit app. You can also get GPS coordinates using Google Earth or other sources then in the search box of the app, enter the coordinates.

replyContent: Do you mean I should make it moving the pin instead of moving the map? Please email yingwentech@gmail.com to discuss. Thanks.

content: This app is a great tool, however whenever I open up a PDF file it automatically opens to this app which I find extremely bothersome.
replyContent: We don't have code to open PDF automatically. It is something you did. You just need to disconnect it in the settings.

content: A must have app for anyone interested in landscape photography and for astrophotographers. Shows the position and height of all solar system objects, stars, milkyway centre relative to the local surrounding areas.  Find a nearby dark site using the light pollution layer, and even simulate the scene through the viewfinder at a future date and time. What shutter speed do I need to prevent star trails? How long an exposure to get complete star trails? Will the moon appear behind that hill? All of this is answered!  I wish I'd found this years ago!
replyContent: Thanks Arthur!

content: This app has the greatest bang-to-buck ratio of all of the apps.
Amazing app. I really like the way it works on my Tab S2 9.7. A lot easier for me to work with than with my Galaxy Note. Well done again David.
replyContent: Thank you Claude!

content: Really stupendous - has so much functionality. This has what you need to plan a landscape shoot. Gives info on where sun/moon will be at any time (particularly rise, set, full moon) in relation to your object. Includes other celestial bodies as well. Using Google maps it also shows terrain shapes/obstacles to aid your precise planning,

content: Must have app. Lots of fun bells and whistles. Each update has something I didn't know I needed

content: All you need to plan your next great picture :D

content: Into photography as a hobby and thought this app looked interesting.  Was amazed with the features and quality.  Just fantastic.

content: It was once very good. But now with the new interface I cant use it. Would love to be able to download the older version

content: Just gets better. Great to have been able to watch the improvements developed. I know they will continue. Well done.

content: I use it constantly to plan my nights out with the camera

There has been some confusion with the latest upgrade but view the YouTube overview video of the changes and all will become clear. All those features are still there but it's actually easier and tidier to get them. Awesome upgrade! Thank you :-)
Please update the videos and online help foro v6.  Still not able to understand pin/unpin camera/scene that was easy in v5. Otherwise, still a great App.
replyContent: There is one video that uses the new UI at https://youtu.be/82SUUKhONXs. We removed the long press to pin/unpin. You got used to it which is why you felt lost but new users had a hard time to figure out that long press can pin/unpin. That's why in the new UI, it is a single tap to pin and unpin which should be more straightforward.

content: At first i had a small problem with app but once I updated it works great for me.I use it for every landscape photo i take glad i didn't give up on it.
replyContent: Thank you for the update

content: Great

I use it for all my night time star trails and astrophotography. Well done guys. This is the perfect app for Android to plan your star trails, plus you can see in AR mode in real time how your star trails will look like. I recommend this for any astrophotography photography

This is the best app of its kind. I feel kinda bad that the Photographer's Ephemeris gets the top spot (not that it's a bad app, but this one is much more useful). I hope that it will be more popular.
replyContent: Thanks. We really just started. Other apps have been out there for many years. So far, we spent zero dollar to prompt the app so that we can keep the app price as low as we can. If you guys can help us spreading the word, it would be appreciated.

content: Current users of the paid version, beware! The newest upgrade forces you back to the free version, and requires you to once again purchase this app. In the app description, the developer notes they will refund your money but only if you send them your Google receipt number found in your email from Google Play when you "first" purchased this app. If you are like me, you do not keep emails from over two years ago for minor purchases. Thus, shame on me for not saving an ancient email, but also shame on the dev
replyContent: You claimed something that is not true. What you don't know is, for people who can't find the order number, they can still see the order date in the play store order history. Based on that date, I will help them to locate the order number from my end. I just you can find the order number from https://payments.google.com/. You can ask for refund.

content: Must have app for photography ..  Worth every penny buying pro version..  New ui is just awsome..

Wow, it looks like it does everything! How will reality match up to the plan remains to be seen as I just installed the app but I've already got several shooting sessions planned out for upcoming vacations thanks to this app - Milky way, sunrise/sunset, etc.  Very very handy. Takes all of the guesswork out of positioning, timing, useful scenario based camera settings, etc.  Be sure to watch YouTube tutorials, then it will all click.
replyContent: Thank you Sam! Please feel free to share your photos which are planned by planit by tagging it with "planit" or "planitforphotographers" on Flickr or 500px.

content: I just updated and all my markers are gone now!!!!!!!!!
replyContent: Hope you save it before. The markers are just temporarily saved in the memory and could be erased by the system. But if you ever saved them as marker files, they will be in your sd card permanently. Or if you saved a plan before, just load the last plan file you saved which should also have the markers in it.

content: Great app

I use it for just about everything. I guess you read these so I shoot at night and sometimes finding my car afterwards can be quite difficult,  could you put a marker for where I parked my car,  it would be so much easier some times especially for locations I go to in daylight then have to backtrack in the dark,  second point can you link the plans to Google navigate so I don't need two plans for the same place.  Thanks hopefully.  Any chance you could build a rangefinder into the app working from the camera? DOF on a fast lens is tight on night shots so getting your hyperfocal right can be a challenge.
replyContent: Could you please email me at yingwentech@gmail.com so that we can discuss more about the features you asked? I didn't quite understand the rangefinder feature? Do you mean a distance ruler? I actually created an advanced ruler pro app (available on the play store) that can do it but haven't undated it as I am too busy with the planit right now.

content: Most useful app for my shoots
Best app till now but bit problem as it some time crashes but the app works wonderfully and solves many unthinkable questions in advance and provide a professional edge for photographic planning .
replyContent: Thanks. The next version will fix it. It is under beta testing right now.

content: I specialized in moon alignment with landmark and this is the only app that helps me confidently plan ahead,  accurately pinpoint the target and achieve the exact view I want to shoot  every month without fail.

content: Great app for photographers with a lot of features. Simply love it
works great

content: Great app once you learn how to use it
This app is: INSANELY. USEFUL. What a nice work, Dev.

Once you get the hang of things, the app becomes much easier to use.

Incredible app! A must have app for any serious landscape photographer. There is a slight learning curve with this app and at first it is a little overwhelming. I recommend watching the YouTube instruction videos to take full advantage of all the features.

content: So many good features, hard to go over one by one. The easy way of sliding the time and seeing the view changes is the most impressive. It even adjusts the view based on lense focal length. content: Great app. It needs a little of time to understand its potentiality and a manual is available.

content: The milkway center crashes on Android N. Otherwise perfect.

content: Over the years I've accumulated several different apps with the aims of aiding my landscape photography. It's a properly put together app and beyond any doubt definitely worth the price. I'm amazed!

content: This app stops my camera from working on my phone. Not happy as payed for the app. Great app if my camera would work.

content: A must have app for any photographer.

content: I'm using the app to find a dark sky. I accidentally turned off this setting and now I'm stuck on a "marker" page with no idea how to get the dark sky map back. In short, incredible functionality, terrible and unintuitive interface.
replyContent: Indeed a lot of "hidden" features. We have to put them in without any useful hints because of the limitation of the phone screen. We will try to improve it in the next few releases after hearing feedback from our users. Just tap on the map to get out of the marker mode.

content: This is by far the best app for organising your landscape photography shoot. Definitely worth every penny. Well done developer for all your hard work üòäüì∑üëåüëçüëè

Good planning is half of landscape photography. And above all, nightscape shots. I usually find myself using some combinations of dark site map + moon phase calendar + panoramio. You get the idea. It can be time consuming and hard to keep track of so many balls juggled in the air. Planit not only gives you those functions, but also visualizes it, which is a HUGE DEAL! Planning and exercising the shots are never this easy by playing with an interactive view. What you see is what you will get. Nailed it!
replyContent: Thank you Xu!

content: Works if you know what you're doing. Easy to follow video (please update video with new version of app) works for my needs. Makes my job a lot easier! Must have for any outdoor photographers!

content: Great, great App.   Bit of a learning curve but really worth the time.   Developer is a genius, if you think you might need this app then do not hesitate to buy, you will not regret it ‚ò∫
Takes a little while to get the hang of but it's sooooo worth it.
Not only is it helpful in planning landscape and astronomy pictures, I love using the app as a way to quickly check various astronomical events.
Please improve more....

Great app. Lots of features. Definitely takes a bit of playing around to figure out everything it can do. One feature I'd love to see added. A photo map aggregating photos from Flickr and other geotagged photo sites as a map layer. Could even sell this as an add on feature.
replyContent: Yes, that's planned. For now I am using Google Earth to do that. Then I add markers on Google Earth, save as kml files, share them to Google Drive, then go to the phone and open them in planit.

content: Nice
replyContent: Thanks. ND filter calculator is actually in the Exposure page. Choose ephemeris icon from the bottom, then select Exposure.

content: Outstanding app for planning shots. Astro shots, panos, cityscapes, timelapses, you name it, it does it. Don't hesitate get it.

content: I have used a lot of other photography planning apps and this is by far the most complete the most accurate the most exact and the most all in one app and tool I've ever used... replyContent: Thanks for understanding the complexity of everything behind this app. We really appreciate it. On the other hand, we are trying to simplify the app. Hopefully in the next few releases, we will make it happen. Please feel free to email yingwentech@gmail.com for any suggestions or feedbacks.

content: Sunset on this app is out by 75 minutes compared to TPE and several weather sites. Sunrise is out by 85 minutes.That does me no good when planning for shoots.
replyContent: You probably pinned your camera location outside the visible map area. All the ephemeris information goes by the camera location, not the center of the map.

content: Such a good app! So much info for planning a shot. Wish I'd got it last week. Went out at night thinking a MW shot.... Looked up, full moon, went to the place I had in mind, MW was behind me. Failed, and disappointed. Now I'm never going unplanned again.
replyContent: That's exactly what happened to me when I decided to write this app ;-)

content: Fantastic app
Very in depth and incredibly use full app for planning to get the best shots

Seriously, as an astrophotographer this app is one of the most used apps on my phone. It let's me plan ahead, let's me adjust during the shoot.  It's just wonderful.  And it works.  No stupid glitches.  Well worth the $ for pro.
after you know how to use it, you would definitely love it!
Awesome.

It's an amazing app with a TON of features. Seriously great value, and a must have for photographers. Only thing I wish was that more places were modeled in the Viewfinder (VR) view. Seems like only a handful of places are.
replyContent: You can add markers to the map then they will be seen in the VR. Eventually we would like to have a more complete database for those places  so that no need for users to add markers but it will take time to get to that stage.

content: Loved it
Awesome app tons of information for planning  a great photos not snapshots.   Quick response from developer too.

Great for planning shots. Weather forecast would be a nice addition. Have to jump back and forth between this and another app.

content: I believe it to be the best photography planning app a photographer could have,  on Android...

content: This app just works,  and works really  well.  I can plan shoots in advance weeks before i will be in the shoot location

content: This is what I have been needing for a very long time,  now I know what my scene will look like months in advance.

content: Really cool, just to make it perfect can you add a sunset predictor.

content: I love doing night photography specifically photos of the milky way and this app is 2nd to none. On top of that the developer is one of the nicest and most helpful people I've come across. He helped me get to know the app better and now this is the only app I use for my photography. Top notch 10 stars would be given if I could. Help him out and buy the paid version it's worth it!

content: Amazing app.

I'm yet to get out and take real photos as a result of using this app, but the possibilities it is enabling are amazing. This app does so much. The potential is limitless. It works beautifully on my phone and the video tutorials have been very helpful.

content: Couldnt want fir more, superb
Best App out there for photographers. Just keeps getting better.
It's almost overwhelming how much cool stuff is in this app! It's probably best used on a larger tablet.

Outstanding photography app. I got this for planning my night sky Milky Way shots at many locations and it works fine for that.  But it is also very useful for a myriad of other photography projects and plans. It even incorporates Google Maps Street View so you can have an on-the-scene preview to help with setting up your shots.  Very very full-featured.  Well worth the minimal $$. It does take a little bit of a learning curve to leverage all of its potential, but it is time well spent...
One of the few apps worth paying for! It keeps on getting better and better
Awesome

Very comprehensive app, it took me awhile to just figure out all the features in it! Looking forward to use it in my upcoming trips!  However, lacking the offline caching feature is a pretty major bummer, as great landscape views & realiable cellphone signal usually don't come together very often... one suggestion to get around the inability to cache from google map is to support kmz format custom maps. I'm an avid hiker and have numerous scanned custom maps. It can be made easily either with google earth or specialty software such as the excellent OkMap(free). There won't be elevation data in the custom map but definitely a lot better than a blank page...
replyContent: Thanks. We are looking for another mapping solution to cache offline map since Google Map doesn't support it.

content: Incredibly useful for planning and visualizing Milky Way shots! The included instructions are very useful and easy to follow.

I'm a landscape photographer, and have always struggled with knowing where to shoot from to catch the best view of a celestial moment...This solves it all. It's packed with features that no other app provides. **Update ** This last week, I was in a position to get a shot of the Milky Way. The app said it would be 'here' at this time...wasn't even close. Luckily I could see the faint signature of the Milky Way behind me, and still got the shot.
replyContent: Michael, you are looking at the wrong thing probably. The milky way are in green/red dots. The most important part is the green dots which are the center of the milky way. You probably looked at the green dots which are other part of the milky way which are not clear. The MW position is VERY accurate.

content: Just starting to use it, but it has everything I was looking for to plan my next shot.  I don't have to go back and forth between several apps now.
A powerful tool. Well worth the cash.

As a newbie in photography, this would be a great help in planning.  My recommendations are: 1. Please include an option to use Open Street Map for it has more details (e.g. Point of Interest, waypoints such as: campsites, trails, waterfalls) that are not documented in Google Map. 2. Please include a weather forecast as well on the particular coordinates of the target place/s. 3. Please allow cache of maps previously loaded and cache of previous results of research for offline use.  Thanks! :)
replyContent: Thanks. I'll check out OSM again. I tried last time but felt it is not as good as Google Map. For example, no terrain view. Weather forecast would be possible. Google map doesn't allow cache the map which is a problem.

content: This is the tool I've been waiting for for years.  I am beyond words to describe how useful and well designed it is. The only thing I would add to the app is a way to sync plans between devices.  A website with the same tool would also be great because planning at home can be easier with a keyboard, mouse and a large screen.
replyContent: Thank you Stam. We will use Google Drive or DropBox or any other cloud storage apps to sync. It is in our plan. For now you will have to menu - share to do it manually. The website tool is not yet in our plan mainly because we have other features and enhancements to do for the apps. We will finish those first before considering the web tool.

content: Forget the rest, this is without doubt the best.
replyContent: Thank you, David.

content: Not the so for a small screen
replyContent: Unfortunately the app has so many features we can't possibly fit them to a tiny screen. While we will try to improve the screen usage to fit into smaller screen, a screen of 4 inch and above is highly recommended.

content: Terrific functionality and feature set that is tremendously helpful when one is planning on photographing any scene that features the sun, moon, or stars. It's become an essential part of my workflow.
replyContent: Thank you. Let me know if you would like to join the beta program. We usually include new features in beta first to collect feedback before releasing it to public.

content: Great app!
The most amazing photography tool I have ever used!
replyContent: Thank you for the 5-star rating. We are glad that you like it :-)

content: Its a great app. Now i just need to spend few days learning it and improving my photography skills.

content: After a slight snafu my ephemeris features are back and the app is back to the version I purchased. I was issued a snappy refund.  The customer service was top notch and every courtesy was extended to me in rectifying the hiccup. I am impressed with developers and look forward to mastering this cerebral application and producing the landcsapes not just before me, but in mind as well. Thanks.

content: This app will go a long way to making trips far more productive and the search for that 'elusive' shot a lot easier.  Thank you thank you thank you :-)
replyContent: You are welcome. I am glad you will it useful.

content: After only a day of use, I can see this is going to be a very useful planning tool.  I have watched the tutorial and am still learning the interfaces.  Certainly more complex than TPE and a bit like a Swiss Army Knife as far as flexibility and applicability to a host of activities.  I do archaeoastronomy documentation in addition to photography and have found the VR view a very useful new tool in my kit. Update:  Through experimentation, I discovered the skyline horizon is very dependent on where the scene icon is placed.  This makes perfect sense in complex terrain with many layers of mountain ridges.  The elevation profile determined from Google Map is analogous to an x-ray slice of a cat scan.  After finding the true obstructing ridgeline (8 km vs 10 km distant), Planit! was spot on in comparison to timing and perspective in reference photos I previously took from the same location.  This is an exceptional product which I highly recommend.
replyContent: Thanks for the updated and five-star rating :)

content: Very detailed and incredibly useful
Really full set of useful tools

This app has it all. I recently went on vacation and used the galaxy part of the app. Even though I couldn't see it, the app told me when and where to point my camera. I now have a few pics of the milky way.
replyContent: Thank you!

content: Thanks!
replyContent: Thank you!

content: Everything I need as amateur photographer

content: This app is extremely good for planning landscape shoots, especially with the ability to save locations and search for date/time when the sun or moon will be in the correct orientation and elevation.  The change in tint on the mapping to show golden hour etc is a nice touch too.  Thanks to a swift response from the developer I now better understand the line of sight feature and it does work very well!  Please add a calculations page for ND filters etc and this will be perfect!
replyContent: Thanks. Just so you know, the 3.4 release added an exposure page which includes ND filter calculator, two light meters and a bulb mode timer as bonus.

content: I live in a country with extreme changes in available sunlight, and varying even further in fjords and yet more in the north. So much so that this is the first, and only, rated review I have given.
